item.title: Big Challenge! Gun Fighter
item.description: Big Challenge! Gun Fighter is the third in Jaleco’s Big Challenge!

item.title: Family Computer Golf: Japan Course
item.description: An update of sorts to Golf. Players get to take control of Nintendo’s mascots Mario and Luigi (in the 2 player game) and play over 18 holes of golf on courses modeled after real courses in Japan.

item.title: Family Computer Golf: Japan Course Prize Cart
item.description: Developed by [HAL Laboratory](/search?q=HAL%20Laboratory?&max-results=12) Published by [Nintendo](/search?q=Nintendo?&max-results=12) Genre: [Sports](/search?q=Sports?&max-results=12) Platform: [Famicom Disk System](/search/label/%40famicom?

item.title: Famimaga Disk Vol. 4: Clox
item.description: Clox, or Famimaga Disk Vol. 4: Clox, is a falling blocks puzzle game that is superficially similar to Tetris or Columns.

item.title: Baseball
item.description: Baseball is a game where the player can pitch, hit, field, and run just like in a real baseball game.

item.title: Baseball
item.description: Baseball is a game where the player can pitch, hit, field, and run just like in a real baseball game.

item.title: Akuu Senki Raijin
item.description: Akuu Senki Raijin is a vertical shooter where the player controls a mecha that transforms into a starfighter.

item.title: Akuu Senki Raijin
item.description: Akuu Senki Raijin is a vertical shooter where the player controls a mecha that transforms into a starfighter.

item.title: A-Train
item.description: The first game in the A-Ressha de Ikou («Let’s Take the A-Train») series, which would eventually become known overseas as A-Train.

item.title: A-Train
item.description: The first game in the A-Ressha de Ikou («Let’s Take the A-Train») series, which would eventually become known overseas as A-Train.

item.title: Family Computer Golf: U.S. Course
item.description: A companion title to the earlier Japan Course, Family Computer Golf: U.

item.title: Famicom Tantei Club Part II: Ushiro ni Tatsu Shoujo: Zenpen
item.description: Ushiro ni Tatsu Shojo is the successor of and a prequel to Famicom Tantei Club: Kieta Kokeisha, and is the second game of the Famicom Tantei Club series.

item.title: Akumajou Dracula
item.description: Every hundred years, the dark vampire known as Dracula resurrects and terrorizes the land.

item.title: Akumajou Dracula
item.description: Every hundred years, the dark vampire known as Dracula resurrects and terrorizes the land.

item.title: Cocona World
item.description: Cocona World is a storybook-styled fantasy adventure game that is superficially similar to The Legend of Zelda and the other top-down action-adventure games that were inspired by it.

item.title: Adian No Tsue
item.description: Adian No Tsue is not a traditional adventure game — It is most and foremost an educational game designed to appeal to a young audience.

item.title: Backgammon
item.description: Backgammon is a straightforward backgammon simulator that allows up to two players to compete in backgammon matches.

item.title: Backgammon
item.description: Backgammon is a straightforward backgammon simulator that allows up to two players to compete in backgammon matches.

item.title: BurgerTime
item.description: The object of the game is to complete a number of hamburgers while avoiding enemy foods.

item.title: Bubble Bobble
item.description: In the game’s plot, «Baron Von Blubba» has kidnapped the brothers Bubby and Bobby’s girlfriends and turned the brothers into Bubble Dragons, Bub and Bob.

item.title: Ai Senshi Nicol
item.description: Ai Senshi Nicol is a top down, action shooter. You play as titular character Nicol, as he fights through a horde of aliens to save his abducted girlfriend.

item.title: Final Fantasy
item.description: The world is veiled in darkness. Winds don’t blow, the seas are stormy, and the earth rots.

item.title: Famimaga Disk Vol. 3: All 1
item.description: All One, or Famimaga Disk Vol. 3: All One, is a puzzle game in which the player controls a ladybug pushing over dice.

item.title: Cleopatra no Mahou
item.description: Players explore an Egyptian town and ruins from a first-person perspective.

item.title: Fire Bam
item.description: Bam must explore a world and «unfold» it into its full size by exploring towers and defeating boss characters inside.

item.title: Final Commando: Akai Yousai
item.description: This earlier version of the game we known as Jackal in the west lacks some of the content that were later added to its NES counterpart, due to the fact that it was released in disk card format rather than on a ROM cartridge.

item.title: Arumana no Kiseki
item.description: The Arumana, a legendary red jewel, has been stolen, and the villagers have all turned to stone.

item.title: Arumana no Kiseki
item.description: The Arumana, a legendary red jewel, has been stolen, and the villagers have all turned to stone.

item.title: Apple Town Monogatari: Little Computer People
item.description: A heavily modified port of Little Computer People, Apple Town Monogatari is an early life simulator.

item.title: Apple Town Monogatari: Little Computer People
item.description: A heavily modified port of Little Computer People, Apple Town Monogatari is an early life simulator.

item.title: Bakutoushi Patton-kun
item.description: Bakutoushi Patton-Kun is an action game developed by Soft Pro and published for the Famicom Disk System in Japan in 1988.

item.title: Bakutoushi Patton-kun
item.description: Bakutoushi Patton-Kun is an action game developed by Soft Pro and published for the Famicom Disk System in Japan in 1988.

item.title: Famimaga Disk Vol. 5: Puyo Puyo
item.description: Puyo Puyo is the first entry of Compile’s Puyo Puyo series.

item.title: Family Composer
item.description: Musical Plan, the developers of Ikinari Musician also for the Famicom, developed this music creation software for the Famicom Disk System to allow users to create their own musical compositions and save them to disk, allowing them to revisit their own tracks or pass them among friends.

item.title: Famimaga Disk Vol. 6: Janken Disk Jou
item.description: Janken Disk Jou, or Famimaga Disk Vol. 6: Janken Disk Jou, is a puzzle game in which the protagonist (who looks uncannily like Disk-kun, the mascot of the Famicom Disk System) must brave a labyrinth of puzzles.

item.title: Dead Zone
item.description: Dead Zone is a futuristic digital comic and text adventure game by Sunsoft.

item.title: Clu Clu Land: Welcome to New Cluclu Land
item.description: In Clu Clu Land, the player is an female balloonfish named Bubbles who swims around in a maze trying to uncover all the golden Ingots.

item.title: aaaaaaaLegend
item.description: All Night Nippon Super Mario Bros. is an officially licensed retool of Super Mario Bros.

item.title: All Night Nippon Super Mario Bros.
item.description: All Night Nippon Super Mario Bros. is an officially licensed retool of Super Mario Bros.

item.title: All Night Nippon Super Mario Bros.
item.description: All Night Nippon Super Mario Bros. is an officially licensed retool of Super Mario Bros.

item.title: All Night Nippon Super Mario Bros.
item.description: All Night Nippon Super Mario Bros. is an officially licensed retool of Super Mario Bros.

item.title: Legend
item.description: All Night Nippon Super Mario Bros. is an officially licensed retool of Super Mario Bros.

item.title: Fuuun Shourin Ken
item.description: In Fuuun Shourin Ken, you control a rising martial artist who strives to defeat other great fighters.

item.title: Deep Dungeon II: Yuushi no Monshou
item.description: The second game in the Deep Dungeon series, Yuushi no Monshou (lit: «Crest of the Hero») is a first-person 3D dungeon crawler RPG in the mold of Wizardry or Dungeon Master.

item.title: Famimaga Disk Vol. 2: Panic Space
item.description: Panic Space, or Famimaga Disk Vol. 2: Panic Space, is a puzzle game in which the goal is to reflect a laser to an exit panel in order to open the way to the next stage.

item.title: Bio Miracle Bokutte Upa
item.description: Upa is the prince of a magical kingdom and the most recent in a line of brave fighters.

item.title: Deep Dungeon: Madou Senki
item.description: The town of Dorl has an infestation of demons who currently reside in the castles dungeon after a portal to the underworld was opened.

item.title: Big Challenge! Juudou Senshuken
item.description: Big Challenge! Judo Senshuken (lit. Big Challenge! Judo Championship) is a Judo-themed competitive sports game developed for the Famicom Disk System and published by Jaleco Entertainment in 1988.

item.title: Big Challenge! Dogfight Spirit
item.description: Big Challenge! Dogfight Spirit is a vertical scrolling shoot ’em up in which the player controls a blue helicopter fighting against waves of enemy vehicles and ground turrets.

item.title: Big Challenge! Dogfight Spirit
item.description: Big Challenge! Dogfight Spirit is a vertical scrolling shoot ’em up in which the player controls a blue helicopter fighting against waves of enemy vehicles and ground turrets.

item.title: Big Challenge! Go! Go! Bowling
item.description: Big Challenge! Go! Go! Bowling is the fourth and final game in the diverse Big Challenge series of Jaleco Famicom Disk System games, and the very last FDS game from Jaleco themselves.

item.title: Big Challenge! Go! Go! Bowling
item.description: Big Challenge! Go! Go! Bowling is the fourth and final game in the diverse Big Challenge series of Jaleco Famicom Disk System games, and the very last FDS game from Jaleco themselves.

item.title: Aspic: Majaou no Noroi
item.description: Aspic is the sequel to one of Xtalsoft’s earlier games, Lizard.

item.title: Aspic: Majaou no Noroi
item.description: Aspic is the sequel to one of Xtalsoft’s earlier games, Lizard.

item.title: Breeder
item.description: Breeder is a sort of fighting game featuring automated fighting robots designed by the player.

item.title: Fire Rock
item.description: Fire Rock is an action platformer developed for the Famicom Disk System by System Sacom, and published in Japan by Use in 1988.

item.title: Bomberman
item.description: Our hero, Bomberman, worked in a bomb factory located in an underground labyrinth.

item.title: Dandy: Zeuon no Fukkatsu
item.description: A conversion port of the Atari 8-Bit computer game Dandy. Though it has been changed quite a bit for it’s Japanese audience and doesn’t resemble the original game very much at all.

item.title: 19: Neunzehn
item.description: The heir to the throne is shared by four brave people: Darius, Simon, Thales, and Sonia.

item.title: Famimaga Disk Vol. 1: Hong Kong
item.description: Hong Kong, or Famimaga Disk Vol. 1: Hong Kong, is a Shanghai variant in which players must remove specified tiles from a pattern.

item.title: Chitei Tairiku Ordola
item.description: Chitei Tairiku Ordola («Underground Continent Ordola») is a Famicom Disk System action platformer from SunSoft and the third part of their Chinou Game Series, each borrowing an existing NES game’s model (in Ordola’s case, Atlantis no Nazo) and adding arithmetic problems to it.

item.title: Akumajou Dracula II: Noroi no Fuuin
item.description: The game’s setting takes place seven years after the original Castlevania.

item.title: Akumajou Dracula II: Noroi no Fuuin
item.description: The game’s setting takes place seven years after the original Castlevania.

item.title: Famicom Tantei Club Part II: Ushiro ni Tatsu Shoujo — Kouhen
item.description: Ushiro ni Tatsu Shojo is the successor of and a prequel to Famicom Tantei Club: Kieta Kokeisha, and is the second game of the Famicom Tantei Club series.

item.title: AAtest
item.description: All Night Nippon Super Mario Bros. is an officially licensed retool of Super Mario Bros.

item.title: Terranigma
item.description: All Night Nippon Super Mario Bros. is an officially licensed retool of Super Mario Bros.
